general: Implement a 'Mobile-First' approach. Start with single column layouts.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'Public Sans' for body text. Import them via Google Fonts in index.css.
Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid' attributes.
Do NOT use generic teal. Use the specific #0E7490 and #06B6D4 hex codes defined in the palette.
The 'DropZone' component is the heart of the app. Make it feel 'magnetic' and premium using framer-motion for hover states.
For the 'Converter Hub', use a dense grid layout. Don't make the cards too big.
Ensure the 'Footer' is dark (Slate 900) to ground the light theme.

pages.home: Focus on the 'DropZone'. It should be the first thing the user sees. Below it, show 'Popular Tools'.
pages.converter_tool: The individual tool page (e.g., /pdf-to-word) should have the tool centered, with SEO content below it.
pages.blog: Clean, editorial layout. Use the 'blog_preview' image for cards.

seo.meta: Ensure every page has dynamic title and description tags.
seo.structure: Use semantic HTML5 tags (main, section, article, aside, nav).

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
